Sarah Ponder: s estimate: Sarah Ponder, who carried the sign at the rally, provided her estimates for the claim. She calculated that the $800,000 cost of the special legislative session could instead pay for 1.6 million condoms, 90,000 months of the pill, or 20 full-time sexual health educators.
Cost of special session: Ponder referenced a news story from Waco ABC affiliate WXXV-TV, which stated that each special session could cost taxpayers more than $800,000. This estimate was based on per-diem payments to legislators to cover their food and expenses.
Cost of contraception: Ponder shared a news story from The Week that stated generic-drug versions of birth control pills cost $9 a month, while brand-name pills cost $90 a month. The information on the availability and costs of contraceptive options was also provided by the National Campaign to Prevent Teen and Unplanned Pregnancy.
Availability of free or low: cost contraception: According to the National Campaign to Prevent Teen and Unplanned Pregnancy, women with Medicaid or private insurance can get the pill for free or just the cost of their co-pay. For women without insurance, generic birth control pills typically cost about $25 a month. This information was confirmed by the group's chief program officer, Bill Albert.
